New Records: Rohit Sharma scored the fastest century for an Indian batsman in a World Cup game
Rohit Sharma is now third on the list of all-time ODI hundreds
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma smashed 12 fours and four sixes on his way to the fastest century for an Indian batsman in a World Cup game
Hashmatullah Shahidi and Azmatullah Omarzai put on a 121-run partnership, the second highest ever in the World Cup for Afghanistan
Shardul Thakur, who was brought in for Ravichandran Ashwin, trapped Rahmat Shah lbw for 16
Kuldeep Yadav bowled with great control, taking 1-40 in 10 overs
Pandya got the breakthrough when he bowled Azmatullah in the 35th over, while Yadav trapped Shahidi lbw in the 43rd
Post-Match Reflections: It was Sharma’s seventh World Cup hundred — the most by an Indian batsman — and his 31st in ODIs
Kohli rounded up India’s night with 55 not out off 56 balls, including six fours, at his home ground
Sharma said, 'It was a good win for us, as it is important to get momentum going at the start of such a tournament'
Sharma said, 'We just need to show up and perform'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rahmanullah Gurbaz (21) and Ibrahim Zadran (22) added 32 runs for the first wicket as the Indian pacers searched for their bearings on a flat track
Mohammed Siraj proved expensive — he finished with 0-76 from nine overs, his joint most expensive spell in ODIs after returning the same figures against Australia on debut in 2019
Shahidi scored 80 off 88 balls, including eight fours and a six, with his half-century coming off 58 deliveries
Azmatullah also scored 50 off 62 balls, and overall scored 62 off 69 balls. He hit two fours and four sixes
India’s next game is against archrival Pakistan in Ahmedabad on Saturday
Others: India's captain Rohit Sharma celebrated his century during the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup match between Afghanistan in New Delhi, India, Wednesday, Oct. 11, 2023
